comment: He's an amazing professor, although he does make you watch videos before class and has pop quizzes within in each lecture. He provides practice exams on d2l and a video on how he solves them, which are very helpful for the test. I would definitely recommend him for people who are willing to put in the work.

I had a TA, Tyler Davis, and he was amazing! He is a grad student so understands we have a busy life and is super straight to the point which I respect. He was quick in giving feedback and is very lenient. Take this professor because you will have a TA for lab and it will be so much easier to handle.

Lillian Daniel was the TA who taught the class instead of Dr. Rojas. I've never met Dr. Rojas or saw him during the semester but I really enjoyed having Lillian instruct the class. She had a very fair grading system and made the few rules that she had pertaining to the class very clear. Would definitely take again in the future if she was teaching.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: I took his lab and instead of Dr. Rojas instructing, we had a TA instead. The TA was actually helpful, sometimes even more helpful than the actual chem lecture professors but I guess that statement depends on which TA you have. The grading scale was fairly easy in my opinion. There is a lab every week and you can skip one of them if you need to.
Great professor who knows his stuff. He was knowledgeable and kind. Although, class requires much more effort than Chem 1211 to exceed.

Dr. Rojas is the best professor I have ever had in my life. He truly cares about helping each student at their own individual needs and sets the class up for success. He has one of the best teaching styles I have ever been exposed to and I really recommend him for anything chemistry. Sad he is leaving for GA tech but deserves it bc he's so smart!

If you HATE Chemistry as I did, PLEASE TAKE Dr. Rojas. He is passionate about chemistry. He is great at conveying the material, and he is understanding and can relate and put himself in the student's shoes. He is accessible outside of class. He also provided Practice Exams that were very helpful prior to the exams itself. IF YOU TAKE CHEM, TAKE HIM

Never met Dr.Rojas once. Students were not notified that this class wasn't taught by him until we came in the first day and had a Graduate student teaching the class. Many people wanted to drop the class as NOBODY was told about this. MD Ackas Ali was a great instructor, but a heads up about this would've been more than appreciated.

He is an amazing person and he is very passionate about chemistry, and his lectures are very enjoyable because he explains things very well. There are homework assignments every week, but he personalizes them so they aren't as difficult as those used in 1211, but this also means you can't find answers online. Tests are hard but not impossible.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Lots of homework

comment: This is without a doubt the best professor I will ever have. Professor Rojas is an excellent professor. With clear grading criteria, EXACTLY exams like the practice tests, & weekly homework, as long as you put in the effort, you will do well. He makes chemistry enjoyable and fun. He is relatable and a nice guy. I wish I could have him every class.

I took his TA lab class, so my actual professor was Mr. Still, but either way, great class. Just be on time, have all your materials (lab notebook, dress properly) and this class will be a breeze. Don't hesitate, his classes fill very quickly.

Came in on the 1st day of lab for 2 minutes, was never seen again. We were taught by a Graduate TA, who had no idea what was going on and often emailed us at 11:55pm w something she forgot to say, explained sig figs wrong (said 0.003 has 4 sig fig). Undergrad TA was amazing and carried the class.

Professor Rojas is a great person and teacher. He has a different teaching style and expects students to come prepared (read beforehand) to class. Honestly, his method has worked for me. We had a mini quiz every class and it counts for a grade. Had 3 exams, an extra credit assignment, and a final. A good professor would recommend taking him.

This is a flipped classroom so you have to do a lot of work outside of class but Dr. Rojas does it for a reason. He really cares about his students and seeing them be successful. He also cares a lot about diversity and inclusion. You have to work hard but he makes it fun! Great in office hours too.

Rojas is probably the best chem professor at KSU. If you suck at at chemistry take his class because hes very helpful and gives one on one explanations on everything. He has a very light workload, and is easy accessible.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Definitely one of the most caring professors Ive ever had. He takes some time before he starts class and goes around and trys to learn everyones name. This is a flipped class so you learn before you come in, then he lectures a little and then you do a worksheet. It takes a minute to get used to, but the lecture will solidify your understanding.

Rojas is super chill and easy to access out of class. Super inclusive of all his students. He expects lots of work outside of the classroom because most class time is spent working out problems on your own. There are quizzes at the beginning of almost every class, but they're a breeze if you do the work outside of class he assigns.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Dr. Rojas never really showed up to the labs, we had TA's teach the class.

Definitely the best professor I had this semester! I struggled throughout the course but he was always happy to help! Do not recommend skipping because while attendance isnt mandatory, it makes a big difference. If youre struggling, talk to him! Lots of homework, but an amazing class. I totally recommend!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Awesome.

He is a great caring person and helps you in any way he can. For sure you can succeed in his class but he does a flipped classroom. So you have to learn at home then come and do practice problems in class. I had to learn from other sources. He also doesn't curve and only gives one point of extra credit. Good choice if you like learning yourself.
rojas is an amazing professor. i would highly recommend using his office hours if you need any help.

Before professor Rojas, I couldn't say I have had a college class that made me enjoy learning. Dr. Rojas is a very straightforward teacher and his lectures will not make you snooze. He gives out a quiz once a week to reinforce the material, and he makes sure that you know every type of question that will be on his exam. Highly recommend.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Dr. Rojas is AMAZING!!! he cares about chemistry and his students and is a very well rounding professor. theres a quiz which he calls a quest every Tuesday, 4 exams and the ACS final which hell replace with your lowest exam grade. he makes you work for your grade though so do what he suggests or you wont get by. overall amazing professor! TAKE !
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Dr. Rojas really cares about his students and loves teaching chemistry. He's very straightforward about expectations and doesn't try to trick you. Honestly if you watch his videos and participate in class you'll do great. He's very helpful in office hours too.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria
